snippet: Frank Lloyd Wright’s home for his son David, in Phoenix, is in danger of being demolished by developers.
abstract: Michael Kimmelman Critic's Notebook observes that Phoenix house designed by Frank Lloyd Wright in 1952 for his son David, is in danger of being demolished by developers; suddenly-galvanized preservationists are trying to have the building designated a landmark, at the same time that they are seeking a preservationist-minded angel with deep pockets who could buy it quickly from the developer.
lead_paragraph: Frank Lloyd Wright’s home for his son David, in Phoenix, is in danger of being demolished by developers.

headline.seo: Frank Lloyd Wright House in Phoenix Faces Bulldozers
headline.main: Wright Masterwork Is Seen in a New Light: A Fight for Its Life
headline.print_headline: Wright Masterwork Is Seen in a New Light: A Fight for Its Life
